message.content:
cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses the problem of choice overload in displaying related-article recommendations in digital libraries, which involves information retrieval (IR) and human-computer interaction (HC) aspects. The empirical evaluation conducted with GESIS' digital library Sowiport and recommendations-as-a-service provider Mr. DLib involves aspects of digital libraries (DL) and potentially cybernetics (CY). The paper also mentions click-through rate as a measure of recommendation effectiveness, which could be related to natural language processing (NLP) and computational linguistics (CL).
